text.tspan: The classes that make up the largest population of Fidelia are the slave and labor classes. Slaves and
laborers are mostly made up of captured people from towns outside of Fidelion, as well as defeated
soldiers and their families. Once enslaved, they are forcibly tattooed on their bodies and faces to
The area is so tightly controlled that it is almost impossible to escape: the high walls and tightly
closed gates are impenetrable by any weapon. As a class society of slaves and laborers, the living
conditions, including the hygiene inside, are appalling, and even the area itself is not spacious
enough, forcing people to live in friction with each other.
The only solace for the laborers and slave class, who live under close surveillance and perform hard
labor, is to take a particular drug called 'dela' and watch the weekly arena battles. The Fidelian
Empire has strategically structured its society to be even more bleak, "providing" an escape from the
suffering of a discriminatory social structure through a culture that addresses one-dimensional needs,
such as physical pleasure through a constant supply of drugs and entertainment through the Arena.
Nevertheless, the number of escape attempts in these zones is much higher than in other zones, and
the suicide rate is also high. The fact that even those who manage to escape are forever on the run
from the Hunters, the dogs of the Empire, casts an even darker shadow over this hopeless society.
Fidelian soldiers are essentially a higher class than laborers. They live in barracks on military bases,
living quarters with various functions such as restaurants and rest areas. Jake is very generous in
allocating resources to train soldiers. Soldiers are incentivized based on their performance, and those
with more achievements and accomplishments have the opportunity to not only rise in rank within the
military but also become higher-ranking citizens. Compared to District S, this is undoubtedly a zone of
This district has physical training grounds to develop physical toughness and a medical center to push
the limits of physical strength with specially formulated body-enhancing drugs. Also within this sector is
a training facility for soldiers, which not only provides military training but also brainwashing to
increase their loyalty to the Fidelian Empire. After completing the courses at the training center, soldiers
are transformed into powerful soldiers capable of fighting and dying for Jake and the Empire.
Most commodity trading in Fidelia takes place in large and small markets, with the government-run
main market being the largest. A wide variety of goods are traded here, either through barter or
currency, mainly for goods looted from the outskirts by soldiers and Hunters. Jake has a limited
amount of control over what is traded here. As such, how prices are set in the marketplace is largely
determined by supply and demand, which, while not heavily regulated, is still punishable by death
for those who go too far and cause severe problems for the citizens' interests. Everything from
trinkets to people is traded within the marketplace, and it's not just slaves that are sold, but
prostitution as well. There is also a tavern within the marketplace, though it is not large, as alcohol
is considered quite a luxury within the Fidelian Empire. The prominent patrons of the taverns are
either Fidelian military officers or Kossack mercenaries, and it's believed that to drink here, one
must have not only the funds but also the courage to not be intimidated by either group.
